function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Use of digital tools for healthcare support","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transposition of activities to virtual platforms may not optimize public administration activities, but only digitize processes.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Simple replacement of physical activities with digital processes may be a shallow level of technological impact.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependency on telephone exchange as a communication strategy may be anachronistic compared to digital devices.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Use of smartphones for monitoring urban agglomerations","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virtual strategies in the area of health and support to the hospital system","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pre-existing infrastructure in cities","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unequal distribution of wealth and resources leading to socioeconomic disparities","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adoption of digital tools in areas with higher socioeconomic development","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uneven distribution of digital initiatives for health and education support","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Proximity between health support strategies and cities with better history of adopting digital tools","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High incidence of results in education support reflecting the need for alternative school arrangements","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of predictability in the distribution of digital initiatives for health and education support","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dual challenge of anticipating demands and responding to emergencies","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tendency to apply digital strategies in contexts with higher gdp per capita or history of digital instrumentation","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Unilateral view of technology as the last solution for demands in cities","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Evolution of digital tooling and crisis-induced learning raising awareness about the role of technology in the urban environment","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dissemination of covid-19 cases shown on the map","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"City awarded in technology and innovation axis","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Direct and indirect spread of the covid-19 infection through respiratory droplets and fecal-oral routes.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 within healthcare and non-healthcare facilities, leading to infections and deaths among healthcare workers and others.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of overwhelming health systems in resource-limited settings due to the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear source and intermediate hosts of sars-cov-2","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Asymptomatic carriers as potential source of virus spread","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virus survival on various surfaces and at low temperatures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Modes of virus transmission including direct and indirect contact, respiratory droplets, and fecal-oral route","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Clinical features and high-risk groups for covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long incubation period of up to 27 days increases the risk of asymptomatic transmission and delayed detection.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher fatality rates among older and immunocompromised individuals pose a significant risk to these population groups.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 from person to person","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher occurrence and fatalities in certain countries","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases in the workplace through shared office tools.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differing levels of hazard and exposure potential to covid-19 in various workplace environments , hospitals and airports .","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Application of failure mode and effects analysis fmea to different workplaces for risk assessment.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of covid-19 preparedness and response plans","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate adherence to basic preventive measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Restrictions on covid-19 testing by private sector","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher risk of covid-19 transmission in healthcare workplaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contact with patients diagnosed
